title: WCAS HISTORY 393-0-20 Approaches to History
topic: The Ant-Slavery Movement in the United States

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Who were the abolitionists and what did they accomplish? Historians have debated these questions for 150 years. As we examine approaches to abolitionism and the anti-slavery movement, we will consider more broadly the history of American social movements and third parties, radical dissent, African American and interracial activism, and arguments over the nature of American liberalism.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Several Short Papers & a Longer Paper

subject: HISTORY
